column4: I don't know why, but my connection wasn't being allowed through my router. I just cloned my hard drive with Acronis True Image, installed it, and now it's working fine. I'm not complaining, but I don't understand how I'm back up.
Is there a way to back up my settings with Ubuntu, just in case I ever need to revert to them?
most "system" settings are in /etc (a few are in the $HOME of the respective application). user settings are in ~/.config and ~/.*
